full_threads.body:
Thanks Heath. We will review transactions to ensure that receipt numbers are generated in a sequential order, for both MS Research Australia and KGTMS websites.

Nadya, please continue to monitor the receipts generated and let us know if the system is not producing the correct receipt numbers.

Thanks

Patrick

Hi Patrick, 

We have added the revised sequential numbers to the website, please allow a couple of days to collect some donations and then we will review.
@heath I made some changes on the site already. I think it would be good to test it out for a few days in order to see the results.

Hi Heath,

Hope this email finds you well. Any solution to the receipt numbering?

Thanks



Patrick Foong

Head of Finance

Thank you for your swift response. I look forward to a solution before I brief our external auditors.

Thanks

Patrick

Hi Patrick, 

Sure, in simple terms, it is issuing sequential numbers as planned, however there have been some instances that where only recently identified, where a receipt number was 'reused'. This has occurred due to overlapping sessions and more-than-likely caching. If a user on computer A visits the website and another user on computer B also visits a website, they will received what's called a cached version of the web page. A cached version of the website is like showing a photo verses a long video. It simplifies what needs to be shown and primarily used to speed up page load times and to reduce the demands placed on servers. This is where it gets tricky... Depending on many factors this cache or snapshot of the website will stay on some computers for long than others and is even affected by internet connections etc. So (in simple terms) if someone is viewing a cached version of the page, where another user has already submitted the donation form, they may be able 'jump in' on that session and use the same receipt number. 

We are currently working on a fix to bullet proof the submission process, whilst allowing sequential numbers. We will be in touch around mid next week with our findings and an update. I hope the above helps to shed some light on the situation.

Hi Heath,

Sorry for my late response due to unplanned leave.

I met with Jason this morning on other matters and we discussed this at some length. Can you please explain in simple terms why our current website cannot generate sequential receipt numbering? This is because the only option our external auditors will accept is sequential receipt numbers produced by the system.

Receipt numbering is a control item to ensure completeness. Any missing numbers in between calls for some explanation.

Many thanks

Patrick

Hi Jason, 

Apologies on my delay in getting back to you on this one. Yes, we can simply issue a randomised number.

Hi Heath,

Thanks for your response to this. I have a few follow up questions to your proposed solution below. Would we be able to just simply issue a random number without changing the prefix and guarantee moving forward we would not be issuing any duplicate receipt numbers (including not reissuing receipt numbers that were issued in sequential order previously, or will the new prefix be required as well?

Even though we are going ahead with a migration to a new community fundraising platform, due to the compliance problems that continued issuing of new receipt numbers would cause we would need to fix it anyway. So I think based on your response to my above question we may need to go ahead with your proposed solution of randomising.

So let me know re the above question and if all is good, I will let you know to go ahead with the randomisation of the receipt numbers.

Thanks,

Jason

Kind regards



Jason Cahill

Database Manager

MS Research Australia

02 8413 7929 • 1300 356 467

jcahill@msra.org.au• http://www.msra.org.au/

Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

Hi Jason, 

Thanks for getting back to us on the below. It appears to be either a bug of some sort or caching of the next sequential order number. As it's not consistently duping, we think it's more likely a caching issue. 

We normally run this with more of a 'random' number to avoid such situations, but a few years ago, it was requested that the website would use the KGTMS prefix and a sequential string of numbers after it. 

To fix this, would it be ok if we randomise the numbers? We can use the Post ID within the system to avoid dupes. Note we can still have the KGTMS prefix and then follow it with a more random number. Let me know what your thoughts are on this? I'm also aware that the kissgoodbyetoms website is moving to RaisersEdge so I'm not sure how much you want us to go into this and the finite time frames of the switch over between the two platforms?

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

Thanks for your response. Unfortunately, I have 2 examples where a receipt number has been issued both times to transactions created in 2019 and 2020 (on the KGTMS site, It seems like the donations on the MSRA site post august 2018 are receipting correctly):

KGTMS-11344

03/01/2020

KGTMS-11344

31/12/2019

KGTMS-10731

09/08/2019

KGTMS-10731

09/08/2019

What would be causing the above dupes if the stipe platform has already been implemented in 2018?

Please do not proceed with any changes yet as we need to discuss internally what we would like to do first.

Kind regards



Jason Cahill

Database Manager

MS Research Australia

02 8413 7929 • 1300 356 467

jcahill@msra.org.au • http://www.msra.org.au/

Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

Hi Jason, 

Apologies in the delay in responding to this query. We have done some investigation and it appears that it was a glitch caused by the old payment gateway 'NABTransact'. We changed over to Stripe around July/August 2018 and this created a more robust payment solution.

Do you want us to retrospectively change these duplicate receipt/ID numbers? I'm not sure that this is the best move from a financial management perspective, but if required we can do so. 

Let me know?

Hi Joel,

I have discovered this when attempting to migrate receipt numbers in our database, we have noticed that different donation records have been issued the same receipt number. Thinking this was initially a clerical error, I then went onto the website to investigate this further. From what can be seen here is that the "Donation Number" on both the KGTMS and MSRA websites, also known as "Invoice Number" and "Receipt Number" can at times be issued multiple times against multiple transactions.

For each site, I went into Donations>donation report, and have set the date filters back to the beginning of time through until now, then downloaded the donations. Attached are the invoice numbers that appear more than once in the report.

Can you please confirm why multiple transactions appear against a single donation number?

When we issue a receipt online, this is the number used, so this cannot be duplicated, as we are legally required to issue a unique receipt number for each donation made by a donor.

Thanks,

Jason

Kind regards



Jason Cahill

Database Manager

MS Research Australia

02 8413 7929 • 1300 356 467

jcahill@msra.org.au • http://www.msra.org.au/

Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060
